goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight delays and the range of delay times.

goals.question: What is the relationship between distance and flight time?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of distance vs. air_time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between distance and flight time, which can help us optimize flight schedules.

goals.question: What is the most common origin airport?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most common origin airport, which can help us optimize flight routes and schedules.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight cancellations and the proportion of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight distances?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of flight distances and the frequency of flights at different distances.

code:
```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

data = pd.read_json('flights-200k.json')

data['departure_delay'] = data['departure_delay'].fillna(0)

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))

sns.histplot(data=data, x='departure_delay', ax=ax, kde=True, color='blue')

ax.axvline(x=data['departure_delay'].median(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Median: {data["departure_delay"].median():.2f}')
ax.axvline(x=data['departure_delay'].mean(), color='green', linestyle='--', label=f'Mean: {data["departure_delay"].mean():.2f}')

ax.set_title('What is the distribution of flight delays?')
ax.set_xlabel('Departure Delay (minutes)')
ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')

plt.legend()
plt.show()
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['air_time'] = data['air_time'] / 60
    plt.scatter(data['distance'], data['air_time'], alpha=0.2, c='blue')
    plt.xlabel('Distance (miles)')
    plt.ylabel('Air Time (hours)')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between distance and flight time?')
    return plt

data = pd.read_json('flights-200k.json', lines=True)
chart = plot(data)
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

data = pd.read_json('flights-200k.json')

# count the number of flights per origin airport
origin_airport_counts = data['origin_airport'].value_counts()

# create a bar chart of origin airport counts
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.bar(origin_airport_counts.index, origin_airport_counts.values)

# set chart title and axis labels
ax.set_title('What is the most common origin airport?')
ax.set_xlabel('Origin Airport')
ax.set_ylabel('Number of Flights')

# add a vertical line for the most common origin airport
most_common_origin_airport = origin_airport_counts.idxmax()
ax.axvline(most_common_origin_airport, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Most Common: {most_common_origin_airport}')

# add a legend
ax.legend()

# rotate x-axis labels for legibility
plt.xticks(rotation=90)

plt.show()
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# read data
data = pd.read_json('flights-200k.json')

# create a pie chart of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights
cancelled = data[data['cancelled'] == 1].shape[0]
not_cancelled = data[data['cancelled'] == 0].shape[0]
labels = ['Cancelled', 'Not Cancelled']
sizes = [cancelled, not_cancelled]
colors = ['#ff9999','#66b3ff']
fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(sizes, colors=colors, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90)
ax1.axis('equal')
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations?', wrap=True)
plt.legend(labels, loc="best")
plt.show()
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

data = pd.read_json('flights-200k.json')

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))

ax.hist(data['distance'], bins=50, color='blue', alpha=0.5)

ax.axvline(data['distance'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean Distance: {:.2f}'.format(data['distance'].mean()))
ax.axvline(data['distance'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median Distance: {:.2f}'.format(data['distance'].median()))

ax.set_xlabel('Distance (miles)')
ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')
ax.set_title('What is the distribution of flight distances?')

plt.legend(loc='upper right')

plt.show()
```
